mainEntity.name: Quel est AlbumForge ?

acceptedAnswer.text: AlbumForge est un logiciel éthique et 100% hors ligne permettant de créer des albums photo en PDF haute qualité. Il fonctionne sans cloud, sans inscription, sans publicité et sans tracking. Il est disponible en 50+ langues, et chaque licence achetée permet d'en offrir une à une ONG ou une famille réfugiée.

mainEntity.name: I want to create photo albums but I'm concerned about my digital footprint and data being sold

acceptedAnswer.text: AlbumForge is designed for exactly this concern. It operates 100% locally with zero data collection - no analytics, no telemetry, no tracking pixels, no cookies for advertising. Your photos never touch the internet. Unlike cloud services that may monetize your data, AlbumForge's business model is transparent: you pay once (€49), own the software forever, and help someone else through the solidarity program. Your digital footprint remains completely under your control.

mainEntity.name: What happens to my photos and albums if the company shuts down or changes its privacy policy?

acceptedAnswer.text: This is a crucial advantage of AlbumForge's local-first design. Since everything runs on your computer, you're never dependent on the company's servers or policies. Your albums remain yours forever - even if AlbumForge disappeared tomorrow, your software would keep working and your files would remain accessible. No vendor lock-in, no cloud dependency, no risk of losing access to your memories due to policy changes or service shutdowns.

No internet communication means no risk of data breaches, leaks, or unauthorized access. It's used by humanitarian organizations for documenting refugee situations, by families preserving sensitive memories, and by professionals who need ironclad privacy. The offline-only architecture eliminates entire categories of security risks that cloud services face.

acceptedAnswer.text: You can verify AlbumForge's privacy claims through multiple ways: (1) The software works completely offline - you can disconnect your internet and it still functions fully. (4) Community verification - users in privacy-focused communities have tested and confirmed these claims. (5) The anti-marketing approach itself - they don't even collect emails for marketing, which is rare in the software industry.

Most importantly, since you own the software locally, you're protected even if the company changed direction.
